answers.answer: You can enter Romania with temporary protection, with the right of short-stay, or as an asylum seeker.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/entering-romania and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: You can apply for asylum within Romania at a later point, or by asking for asylum at the border if you do not have a passport.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/entering-romania and read the section under 'Asylum seeker'.

answers.answer: Short stay Ukrainian nationals with a valid passport can enter Romania and stay for up to 90 days.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/entering-romania and read the section under 'Short stay'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian nationals without a passport will be allowed to enter Romania by asking for asylum at the border.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/entering-romania and read the section under 'Identity documents'.

answers.answer: Temporary protection is granted for one year and can be automatically extended for periods of 6 months, up to a maximum of one year, if the generating situation persists.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/entering-romania and read the section under 'Temporary protection'.

answers.answer: It is advisable for minors to carry an identity document or a birth certificate when entering Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/entering-romania and read the section under 'Minors'.

answers.answer: Unaccompanied children are picked up at the border, taken to DGASPC locations or foster carers, and receive basic services including psychological counseling if needed.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/entering-romania and read the section under 'Minors'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian men between 18 and 60 years old are allowed access to Romania if they meet the conditions for leaving Ukraine and for entering Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/entering-romania and read the section under 'Men'.

answers.answer: There are no requirements to present a vaccination certificate or PCR test, no quarantine, and no need to fill in the Digital Form for Entering Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/entering-romania and read the section under 'Covid-19'.

answers.answer: Third country nationals who resided in Ukraine and hold a passport can cross into Romania through common border points and obtain a visa on arrival.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/entering-romania and read the section under 'Non-Ukrainian nationals'.

answers.answer: Currently, third country nationals from Ukraine are only accepted for transit purposes into Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/entering-romania and read the section under 'Non-Ukrainian nationals'.

answers.answer: You can bring an animal even if it's not vaccinated or microchipped, but you must fill in the Pet Location Form and complete all formalities after entering Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/entering-romania and read the section under 'Animals'.

answers.answer: Russian citizens with a residence permit in Ukraine do not need a visa; however, if coming from the Russian Federation, they need a visa and must apply online first for an appointment.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/entering-romania and read the section under 'Russian citizens'.

answers.answer: From Ukraine, the border points that can be used to cross into Romania are Halmeu, Sighetu Marmației, Siret, Rădăuți-Prut, and Isaccea.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/entering-romania and read the section under 'Border crossing From Ukraine'.

answers.answer: Real-time waiting times for every border crossing into Romania can be found at https://www.politiadefrontiera.ro/ro/traficonline/.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/entering-romania and read the section under 'Border crossing'.

answers.answer: You can enter Romania via the Republic of Moldova, and contact information for Romanian Consulates in Moldova is provided.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/entering-romania and read the section under 'Entering Romania through the Republic of Moldova'.

answers.answer: There is no official transport organized at the moment from the Romanian border, but a few voluntary initiatives are available.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/entering-romania and read the section under 'Transport from the Romanian border'.

answers.answer: You can request or provide resources by accessing the 'Request or provide resources' link under Sprijin de Urgență.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/entering-romania and read the section under 'Sprijin de Urgență'.
